titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2842, ACCELERATING INDIVIDUALS INTO THE WORKFORCE ACT, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF MOTIONS TO SUSPEND THE RULES

name.namePart: Committee on Public Works and Transportation

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2842, ACCELERATING INDIVIDUALS INTO THE WORKFORCE ACT, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF MOTIONS TO SUSPEND THE RULES; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 107

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Accelerating Individuals into the Workforce Act_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 396, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2842) to provide for the conduct of demonstration projects to test the effectiveness of subsidized employment for TANF recipients, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules, by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 179 noes, Roll No. 317, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 226 yeas to 184 nays, Roll No. 316.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Accelerating Individuals into the Workforce Act_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 396, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2842) to provide for the conduct of demonstration projects to test the effectiveness of subsidized employment for TANF recipients, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules, by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 179 noes, Roll No. 317, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 226 yeas to 184 nays, Roll No. 316.

extension.searchTitle: WATER SUPPLY PERMITTING COORDINATION ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 107

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1654, to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to coordinate Federal and State permitting processes related to the construction of new surface water storage projects on lands under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture and to designate the Bureau of Reclamation as the lead agency for permit processing, by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 180 noes, Roll No. 319.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Two record votes were taken today. (Total_153)<P/>Senate resumed consideration of the nomination of Kristine L. Svinicki, of Virginia, to be a Member of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 89 yeas to 10 nays (Vote No. 153), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
